## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
old_data=read.csv("/home/CAMPUS/mmba2018/Climate_Change_Narratives/student_folders/Floyd/Makeda_Los Angeles_data.csv")
climate_data=old_data[3000:38565,]
strDates=as.character(climate_data$DATE)
climate_data$NewDate=as.Date(strDates, "%m/%d/%Y")
plot(TMAX~NewDate, climate_data, ty='l')
abline(lm(TMAX~NewDate,climate_data),col="red")
lm(TMAX ~ NewDate, data=climate_data)
summary(lm(TMAX ~ NewDate, data=climate_data))
climate_data$Month = format(as.Date(climate_data$NewDate), format = "%m")
climate_data$Year = format(climate_data$NewDate, format="%Y")
MonthlyTMAXMean = aggregate(TMAX ~ Month + Year, climate_data, mean)
MonthlyTMAXMean$YEAR = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Year)
MonthlyTMAXMean$MONTH = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Month)
plot(MonthlyTMAXMean$TMAX, ty='l')
plot(TMAX~YEAR, data=MonthlyTMAXMean[MonthlyTMAXMean$Month=="05",],
ty='l', xlim=c(1920, 2020))
May.lm <- lm(TMAX~YEAR, data=MonthlyTMAXMean[MonthlyTMAXMean$Month=="05",])
summary(May.lm)
abline(coef(May.lm), col="red")

```
